properties.tooltip: The name of the column that will be the input of the CountVectorizer process.
The name of the column that will be the input of the CountVectorizer process.
If true, all non zero counts are set to 1. This is useful for discrete probabilistic models that model binary events rather than integer counts.

properties.propertyName: Min number of documents a term must appear
properties.tooltip: Specifies the minimum number of different documents a term must appear in to be included in the vocabulary. If this is an integer >= 1, this specifies the number of documents the term must appear in; if this is a double in [0,1), then this specifies the fraction of documents.

properties.propertyName: Ignore documents that appear less than
properties.tooltip: Filter to ignore rare words in a document. For each document, terms with frequency/count less than the given threshold are ignored. If this is an integer >= 1, then this specifies a count (of times the term must appear in the document); if this is a double in [0,1), then this specifies a fraction (out of the document's token count). Note that the parameter is only used in transform of CountVectorizerModel and does not affect fitting.
